item.title: What makes employees smile at TowerJazz
item.description:
To celebrate TowerJazz reaching a $1 billion run rate, we asked employees what they like about working at the company and what makes them smile. Here is a video with some of their answers.

I worked on the concept for this video with Ela Pappo and Felize Richens then shot and edited it for the celebration.

item.title: Smart Post
item.description:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll’s dedicated Help repository.

item.title: Thought Posters
item.description: Concepts I had on my mind that I decided to make into posters for my flat.

item.title: Learning about biological pest control with GAIA
item.description:
GAIA (Global Awareness, Investigation and Action) Environmental Youth Collaboration Program completed its eight-week agenda with a four-day investigative trip to the Galilee and Negev in Israel. The trip focus was on scientific discovery regarding biological pest control. Participants included students from five schools in Israel as well two partner schools from the Czech Republic. Leading the trip was Dr. Stuart Fleischer, Director of Project GAIA and Dr. Motti Charter of Haifa University.

A classmate and I received a research grant from Maryland Institute College of Art to attend, observe and learn about the collaborative structure and hands-on teaching methodologies as well as document the trip and create summary posters and videos.

item.title: Tabitha Silk Products Catalog
item.description:
The Tabitha Foundation focuses on community development and cottage industry in Cambodia. Financial sustainability is derived partly from silk weaving cottage industry. Silk sales pay for 80% of all administrative costs. Working in Tabitha’s cottage industry, women develop job skills and are paid fair wages allowing them to take care of themselves and their families.

When I learned about Tabitha and wanted to purchase products, I had a hard time knowing what the products looked like from the photos in the reference catalog. So while in Phnom Penh on a forPEACE service-learning trip, I pulled together a couple photoshoots at their store and a local hotel and recruited a couple team members as models. Then took supplementary shots when I returned and put together this catalog for them.

View the catalog
